topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5386d3766368723973d90000#post_5386d3766368723973d90000


its not fully resolved, but in a couple days it will be.

its still sensitive to rough touch (i can poke my glans but thats it)
and it doesnt go all the way trough when fully erected.

yeah no surgery, thats like the easy way out, but the problem is that would have left a incredibly sensitive glans unexposed completely, and adapting would have hurt and been uncoftable for days.

"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5386d31e636872371aa30000#post_5386d31e636872371aa30000

the sad part is they never teach you that thats not normal or anything ever, even after doctors saw how i couldnt pull it or how sensitive it was.

it does hurt the first stretching exercises, but you then get used to it.
topics.author: 5154c5237f123bcd580002fc

topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5386d66a63687237df650100#post_5386d66a63687237df650100

our sex ed was like seriously nothing, it was pretty basic , talking about how babies are formed and STD and stuff, but it got cancelled pretty quickly.

when i told some people about my problem they are surprised, like dispite being a common problem little people know about phimosis and [spoiler]glan[/spoiler] extra sensitity, not even i knew, i thought that by the time i hit like 19 or 20 it would solve itself.

i think sex ed classes should encourage students more to talk with their teacher or parents about these kinds of problems, and inform more about these kinds of problems.

like really all doctors that saw my dick never stopped and said "isnt it weird he is so sensitive, and why cant i move his [spoiler]foreskin[/spoiler] all the way?".
topics.author: 5154c5237f123bcd580002fc

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5386d79563687238aab60100#post_5386d79563687238aab60100
The fear of sex in general mystifies me.

Take your case, you say its fairly common so it shouldn't be that weird to say that "oh, he has X problem, Y is the solution," and if it was a problem with any other part of your body that is likely exactly what would have happened, but since its a penis, you know, something fifty fucking percent of the human population has, no one wants to talk about it.
